text: The word of the Lord which came to Micah of Moresheth in the days of Jotham, Ahaz, and Hezekiah, kings of Judah, and which he saw regarding Samaria and Jerusalem.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Hear, you peoples, all of you;
Listen carefully, earth and all it contains,
And may the Lord God be a witness against you,
The Lord from His holy temple.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For behold, the Lord is coming forth from His place.
He will come down and tread on the high places of the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The mountains will melt under Him
And the valleys will be split,
Like wax before the fire,
Like water poured down a steep place.
speaker: Narrator

text:
All this is due to the wrongdoing of Jacob
And the sins of the house of Israel.
What is the wrongdoing of Jacob?
Is it not Samaria?
What is the high place of Judah?
Is it not Jerusalem?
speaker: Narrator

text:
For I will make Samaria a heap of ruins in the open country,
Planting places for a vineyard.
I will hurl her stones down into the valley,
And lay bare her foundations.
speaker: Narrator

text:
All of her idols will be crushed,
All of her earnings will be burned with fire,
And all of her images I will make desolate;
For she collected them from a prostitute’s earnings,
And to the earnings of a prostitute they will return.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Because of this I must mourn and wail,
I must go barefoot and naked;
I must do mourning like the jackals,
And a mourning like the ostriches.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For her wound is incurable,
For it has come to Judah;
It has reached the gate of my people,
Even to Jerusalem.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Do not tell it in Gath,
Do not weep at all.
At Beth-le-aphrah roll yourself in the dust in mourning.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Go on your way, inhabitant of Shaphir, in shameful nakedness.
The inhabitant of Zaanan does not escape.
The mourning of Beth-ezel: “He will take from you its support.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
For the inhabitant of Maroth
Waits for something good,
Because a disaster has come down from the Lord
To the gate of Jerusalem.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Harness the chariot to the team of horses,
You inhabitant of Lachish—
She was the beginning of sin
To the daughter of Zion—
Because in you were found
The rebellious acts of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Therefore you will give parting gifts
In behalf of Moresheth-gath;
The houses of Achzib will become a deception
To the kings of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Moreover, I will bring on you
The one who takes possession,
You inhabitant of Mareshah.
The glory of Israel will enter Adullam.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Shave yourself bald, yes, cut off your hair,
Because of the children of your delight;
Extend your baldness like the eagle,
For they will go from you into exile.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Woe to those who devise wrongdoing,
Who practice evil on their beds!
When morning comes, they do it,
Because it is in the power of their hands.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They covet fields, so they seize them;
And houses, so they take them.
They exploit a man and his house,
A person and his inheritance.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Therefore this is what the Lord says:
“Behold, I am planning against this family a catastrophe
From which you cannot remove your necks;
And you will not walk haughtily,
For it will be an evil time.
speaker: Narrator

text:
On that day they will take up against you a song of mocking
And utter a song of mourning and say,
‘We are completely destroyed!
He exchanges the share of my people;
How He removes it from me!
To the apostate He apportions our fields.’
speaker: Narrator

text:
Therefore you will have no one applying a measuring line
For you by lot in the assembly of the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text:
‘Do not prophesy,’ so they prophesy.
But if they do not prophesy about these things,
Insults will not be turned back.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Is it being said, house of Jacob:
‘Is the Spirit of the Lord impatient?
Are these His works?’
Do My words not do good
For the one walking rightly?
speaker: Narrator

text:
Recently My people have arisen as an enemy—
You strip the robe off the garment
From unsuspecting passers-by,
From those returned from war.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You evict the women of My people,
Each one from her pleasant house.
From her children you take My splendor forever.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Arise and go,
For this is no place of rest
Because of the uncleanness that brings on destruction,
A painful destruction.
speaker: Narrator

text:
If someone walking after wind and falsehood
Had lied and said,
‘I will prophesy to you about wine and liquor,’
He would become a prophet to this people.
speaker: Narrator

text:
“I will certainly assemble all of you, Jacob,
I will certainly gather the remnant of Israel.
I will put them together like sheep in the fold;
Like a flock in the midst of its pasture
They will be noisy with people.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The one who breaks through goes up before them;
They break through, pass through the gate, and go out by it.
So their king passes on before them,
And the Lord at their head.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
And I said,
“Hear now, you leaders of Jacob
And rulers of the house of Israel:
Is it not for you to know justice?
speaker: Narrator

text:
You who hate good and love evil,
Who tear off their skin from them
And their flesh from their bones,
speaker: Narrator

text:
Who eat the flesh of my people,
Strip off their skin from them,
Smash their bones,
And chop them up as for the pot,
And as meat in a cauldron!”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Then they will cry out to the Lord,
But He will not answer them.
Instead, He will hide His face from them at that time
Because they have practiced evil deeds.
speaker: Narrator

text:
This is what the Lord says concerning the prophets who lead my people astray:
When they have something to bite with their teeth,
They cry out, “Peace!”
But against him who puts nothing in their mouths
They declare holy war.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Therefore it will be night for you—without vision,
And darkness for you—without divination.
The sun will go down on the prophets,
And the day will become dark over them.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The seers will be put to shame,
And the diviners will be ashamed.
Indeed, they will all cover their lips
Because there is no answer from God.
speaker: Narrator

text:
On the other hand, I am filled with power—
With the Spirit of the Lord—
And with justice and courage
To make known to Jacob his rebellious act,
And to Israel his sin.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Now hear this, you heads of the house of Jacob
And rulers of the house of Israel,
Who despise justice
And twist everything that is straight,
speaker: Narrator

text:
Who build Zion with bloodshed,
And Jerusalem with malice.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Her leaders pronounce judgment for a bribe,
Her priests teach for pay,
And her prophets divine for money.
Yet they lean on the Lord, saying,
“Is the Lord not in our midst?
Catastrophe will not come upon us.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Therefore on account of you,
Zion will be plowed like a field,
Jerusalem will become a heap of ruins,
And the mountain of the temple will become high places of a forest.
speaker: Narrator

text:
And it will come about in the last days
That the mountain of the house of the Lord
Will be established as the chief of the mountains.
It will be raised above the hills,
And the peoples will stream to it.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Many nations will come and say,
“Come and let’s go up to the mountain of the Lord
And to the house of the God of Jacob,
So that He may teach us about His ways,
And that we may walk in His paths.”
For from Zion will go forth the law,
And the word of the Lord from Jerusalem.
speaker: Narrator

text:
And He will judge between many peoples
And render decisions for mighty, distant nations.
Then they will beat their swords into plowshares,
And their spears into pruning hooks;
Nation will not lift a sword against nation,
And never again will they train for war.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Instead, each of them will sit under his vine
And under his fig tree,
With no one to make them afraid,
Because the mouth of the Lord of armies has spoken.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Though all the peoples walk,
Each in the name of his god,
As for us, we will walk
In the name of the Lord our God forever and ever.
speaker: Narrator

text:
“On that day,” declares the Lord,
“I will assemble those who limp
And gather the scattered,
Those whom I have afflicted.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will make those who limp a remnant,
And those who have strayed a mighty nation,
And the Lord will reign over them on Mount Zion
From now on and forever.
speaker: Narrator

text:
As for you, tower of the flock,
Hill of the daughter of Zion,
To you it will come—
Yes, the former dominion will come,
The kingdom of the daughter of Jerusalem.
speaker: Narrator

text:
“Now, why do you cry out loudly?
Is there no king among you,
Or has your counselor perished,
That agony has gripped you like a woman in childbirth?
speaker: Narrator

text:
Writhe and scream,
Daughter of Zion,
Like a woman in childbirth;
For now you will go out of the city,
Live in the field,
And go to Babylon.
There you will be rescued,
There the Lord will redeem you
From the hand of your enemies.
speaker: Narrator

text:
And now many nations have been assembled against you
Who say, ‘Let her be defiled,
And let our eyes gloat over Zion!’
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
Arise and thresh, daughter of Zion,
For I will make your horn iron,
And I will make your hoofs bronze,
So that you may pulverize many peoples,
And dedicate to the Lord their unjust profit,
And their wealth to the Lord of all the earth.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
But as for you, Bethlehem Ephrathah,
Too little to be among the clans of Judah,
From you One will come forth for Me to be ruler in Israel.
His times of coming forth are from long ago,
From the days of eternity.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Therefore He will give them up until the time
When she who is in labor has given birth.
Then the remainder of His kinsmen
Will return to the sons of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text:
And He will arise and shepherd His flock
In the strength of the Lord,
In the majesty of the name of the Lord His God.
And they will remain,
Because at that time He will be great
To the ends of the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text:
This One will be our peace.
When the Assyrian invades our land,
When he tramples on our citadels,
Then we will raise against him
Seven shepherds and eight leaders of people.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They will shepherd the land of Assyria with the sword,
The land of Nimrod at its entrances;
And He will rescue us from the Assyrian
When he invades our land,
And when he tramples our territory.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Then the remnant of Jacob
Will be among many peoples
Like dew from the Lord,
Like showers on vegetation
That do not wait for man,
Or delay for mankind.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The remnant of Jacob
Will be among the nations,
Among many peoples
Like a lion among the animals of the forest,
Like a young lion among flocks of sheep,
Which, if he passes through,
Tramples and tears,
And there is no one who can rescue.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Your hand will be lifted up against your adversaries,
And all your enemies will be eliminated.
speaker: Narrator

text:
“And it will be on that day,” declares the Lord,
“That I will eliminate your horses from among you,
And destroy your chariots.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will also eliminate the cities of your land,
And tear down all your fortifications.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will eliminate sorceries from your hand,
And you will have no fortune-tellers.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will eliminate your carved images
And your memorial stones from among you,
So that you will no longer bow down
To the work of your hands.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will uproot your Asherim from among you,
And destroy your cities.
speaker: Narrator

text:
And I will execute vengeance in anger and wrath
On the nations which have not obeyed.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Hear now what the Lord is saying,
“Arise, plead your case before the mountains,
And let the hills hear your voice.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Listen, you mountains, to the indictment by the Lord,
And you enduring foundations of the earth,
Because the Lord has a case against His people;
And He will dispute with Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text:
My people, what have I done to you,
And how have I wearied you? Answer Me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Indeed, I brought you up from the land of Egypt,
I redeemed you from the house of slavery,
And I sent before you Moses, Aaron, and Miriam.
speaker: Narrator

text:
My people, remember now
What Balak king of Moab planned
And what Balaam son of Beor answered him,
And what happened from Shittim to Gilgal,
So that you might know the righteous acts of the Lord.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
With what shall I come to the Lord
And bow myself before the God on high?
Shall I come to Him with burnt offerings,
With yearling calves?
speaker: Narrator

text:
Does the Lord take pleasure in thousands of rams,
In ten thousand rivers of oil?
Shall I give Him my firstborn for my wrongdoings,
The fruit of my body for the sin of my soul?
speaker: Narrator

text:
He has told you, mortal one, what is good;
And what does the Lord require of you
But to do justice, to love kindness,
And to walk humbly with your God?
speaker: Narrator

text:
The voice of the Lord will call to the city—
And it is sound wisdom to fear Your name:
“Hear, you tribe. Who has designated its time?
speaker: Narrator

text:
Is there still a person in the wicked house,
Along with treasures of wickedness,
And a short measure that is cursed?
speaker: Narrator

text:
Can I justify dishonest balances,
And a bag of fraudulent weights?
speaker: Narrator

text:
For the rich people of the city are full of violence,
Her residents speak lies,
And their tongue is deceitful in their mouth.
speaker: Narrator

text:
So also I will make you sick, striking you down,
Making you desolate because of your sins.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You will eat, but you will not be satisfied,
And your filth will be in your midst.
You will try to remove valuables for safekeeping,
But you will not save it all,
And what you do save I will turn over to the sword.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
The statutes of Omri
And every work of the house of Ahab are maintained,
And you walk by their plans.
Therefore I will give you up for destruction,
And your inhabitants for derision,
And you will suffer the taunting of My people.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Woe to me! For I am
Like harvests of summer fruit, like gleanings of grapes.
There is not a cluster of grapes left to eat,
Nor an early fig, which I crave.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The godly person has perished from the land,
And there is no upright person among mankind.
All of them lie in wait for bloodshed;
Each of them hunts the other with a net.
speaker: Narrator

text:
As for evil, both hands do it well.
The leader asks for a bribe, also the judge,
And the great one speaks the capricious desire of his soul;
So they plot it together.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The best of them is like a thorn bush,
The most upright like a thorn hedge.
The day when you post your watchmen,
Your punishment is coming.
Then their confusion will occur.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Do not trust in a neighbor;
Do not have confidence in a close friend.
Guard your lips
From her who lies in your arms.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For son disavows father,
Daughter rises up against her mother,
Daughter-in-law against her mother-in-law;
A person’s enemies are the people of his own household.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

text:
I will endure the rage of the Lord
Because I have sinned against Him,
Until He pleads my case and executes justice for me.
He will bring me out to the light,
And I will look at His righteousness.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Then my enemy will see,
And shame will cover her who said to me,
“Where is the Lord your God?”
My eyes will look at her;
At that time she will be trampled down
Like mud of the streets.
speaker: Narrator

text:
It will be a day for building your walls.
On that day your boundary will be extended.
speaker: Narrator

text:
It will be a day when they will come to you
From Assyria and the cities of Egypt,
From Egypt even to the Euphrates River,
Even from sea to sea and mountain to mountain.
speaker: Narrator

text:
And the earth will become a wasteland because of her inhabitants,
On account of the fruit of their deeds.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Shepherd Your people with Your scepter,
The flock of Your possession
Which lives by itself in the woodland,
In the midst of a fruitful field.
Let them feed in Bashan and Gilead
As in the days of old.
speaker: Narrator

text:
“As in the days when you went out from the land of Egypt,
I will show you miracles.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Nations will see and be ashamed
Of all their might.
They will put their hand on their mouth,
Their ears will be deaf.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They will lick up dust like a snake,
Like reptiles of the earth.
They will come trembling out of their fortresses;
To the Lord our God they will come in trepidation,
And they will be afraid of You.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Who is a God like You, who pardons wrongdoing
And passes over a rebellious act of the remnant of His possession?
He does not retain His anger forever,
Because He delights in mercy.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He will again take pity on us;
He will trample on our wrongdoings.
Yes, You will cast all their sins
Into the depths of the sea.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You will give truth to Jacob
And favor to Abraham,
Which You swore to our forefathers
From the days of old.
speaker: Narrator
